intro: Aporum concinnum, commonly known as the red spider lily, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has strap-like, dark green leaves that emerge from a bulbous base. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Aporum concinnum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also noted for its ability to naturalize in suitable environments.
